The table below shows the summary of the stock findings on 26.03.25

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was -159pieces

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·       The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.
attributes.effect: + Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: ·      More improvement measures will be initiated.
·       More improvement measures will be initiated.
+ Physical stock verified on 26.02.25 showed minimal item variation.
Previous

+ A stock take exercise was conducted on 26.03.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Physical stock count showed minimal item variation hence the company is not exposed to item loss risk.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis.
attributes.description:
1)      Dough weights:

·          The below table shows analysis of dough weights sampled on 28/03/2025;

Dough weights sampled on 26.03.2025:(!st shift @08.00am)

Dough weights showed high overweight rate.
attributes.recommendation: + Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread. This also will check noted high overweight dough samples.
attributes.effect: + High overweight dough rate lowers yield targets hence withholding revenue targets.

value: + We will continue to sensitize dough dividers to adhered to set dough dividing weights to address overweight bread noted.
+ We are strict to eradicate underweight bread production hence high overweight dough rate. We will however be strict to dough dividers to adhere to set dough dividing weights.
·         Sample varieties of dough  were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to set standard dough dividing weights .
+ High overweight dough rate was noted hence non-compliance to set dough dividing weights.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set standard dough dividing weights.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis.
attributes.description:
1)      Packed bread weights.

·         Bread weights were sampled on 26/03/2025 and the following below were the results.

High overweight packed bread rate was noted.
attributes.recommendation:
+  Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

+ Noted high overweight bread should be addressed.
attributes.effect: + High overweight bread rate lowers yield targets hence revenue targets not realized.

value: + Noted high overweight bread will be addressed by ensuring set dough dividing weight ranges are adhered to.
+ High overweight bread rate will be addressed.

·         Bread weights sampled on 28.02.25 showed high underweight rate for the following SKUs;

200g OT white=46.38%, 400g Supa Nutri=66.67% and 1.5kg CT white=13.64%.
Previous
+ Sample varieties of d packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Packed bread weights showed high overweight rate. This showed non compliance to set standards.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damage (production and market damage) analysis
attributes.description:
PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation: + Noted high production damages should be addressed.
attributes.effect: + High production damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized.

value: + We will put more efforts to address noted high production damages.
+ Noted high production damages will be addressed.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that bread damages were within the allowed rates as analyzed from 01.02.25 – 25.02.25.
Previous

+ The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

+ High production damages noted.

+ Non-compliance to tolerable set bread damage rate.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring controlled bread rate within the acceptable levels.

attributes.title: Mixing charts analysis.
attributes.description:
Mixing charts and summaries were analyzed from 01.03.25 - 25.03.2025.

Below are the summary of the findings

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·          Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect:
+ Adherence to set raw material consumption quantities checks wastage and ensures quality bread production.

+ Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
+ We will always ensure that actual production is reflected on production records/registers,
+ February 2025 audit report showed that raw materials were consumed as per set standards.
Previous
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.03.25 – 25.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Raw material consumption was as per set standards hence compliance to set policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring issuing and consumption of raw materials was as per set standards.

attributes.title: Bread yields analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Individual bread variety yield analysis is tabulated below. The table shows production in bags for each variety and resulting yield from production records against those expected;

attributes.recommendation: + Set yield targets should be adhered to maximize revenues as observed.
attributes.effect: + Achieving of set standard bread yields as per BOM ensures revenue targets are realized.

value: + Set yields were realized as per BOM.
+ We will continue to ensure that set bread yields for all bread varieties is realized.
+ Set bread yields were realized as highlighted on February 2025 audit report as analyzed from 01.02.25 - 28.02.2025.
Previous

Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set bread yields are realized.

attributes.title: Debtors analysis.
attributes.description: ·         Outstanding debts for customers was Kshs.176,473.00 .
attributes.recommendation: + Sales team must ensure credit limits for institutions are set and follow up.
attributes.effect: + High route balances without equal security deposit poses a great risk to the company of bad debts.

value:
·   Mirogi route debt incurred after turn boy vanished with cash and the case escalated to head office.

·      Nyamira mini shop debt was due to returns but these were invoiced the following day and paid for.

 +    Other customer’s debts are recovered from their respective extra cents deposits.

·         Mirogi route case was escalated to head office after turn boy ran away with cash.

·         Nyamira mini shop debt was due to returns but was invoiced the following day and cleared.

·         Most of these balances are with customers with security deposits equal or more compared to the debt.
+ Debtor analysis dated 01.03.2025 showed outstanding balances totaling to Kshs. 234,926.00 for institutions and Kshs. 228,160.00 for route customers.
Previous
·    Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 26th March 2025 for routes and institutions was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ Outstanding customer balances were noted.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring no outstanding debts.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis
attributes.description: ·          Analysis was done from 01/03/2025 - 25/03/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

·          The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.
attributes.effect: + Adherence to set operational efficiency standards checked production costs.

value: + Set standard packing and production efficiencies will be maintained.
+ Noted trend will be maintained and even improved.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted production inefficiency that led to hiring of extra 16workers costing the company surplus wages of Kshs. 17,385.60.
Previous
·          This test was conducted to determine if set production  efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Set production efficiency was realized hence compliance to operational efficiency policy.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set production efficiency policies.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle set fuel consumption standard.

attributes.recommendation: + Vehicles having set fuel consumption rate is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Motor vehicles having set fuel consumption rate makes it easy to monitor fuel consumption and ensure accountability for fuel.

value: + We always ensure that all sales vehicles have set fuel consumption rate upon receipt of van from KAF.
+ All vans have set fuel consumption standards as per set policies.
+ February audit report highlighted that all motor vehicles had set fuel consumption standards.
Previous
·           The exercise was carried out to determine if all motor vehicles had set fuel consumption rate as per required.
+ Sales vans have set fuel consumption rate as per policy requirements hence compliance.

+ Ensuring all motor vehicles have set fuel consumption rates before being used to do bread deliveries.

GENERATOR : (01/03/25 - 31/03/25)
attributes.recommendation:
+ High generator fuel consumption rate should be addressed.

+ Generator should have set standard fuel consumption rate.
attributes.effect: + High fuel consumption increased operations costs.

value: + High fuel consumption for the generator was due to mechanical breakdown. Technicians have since fixed the issue.
+ Generator had a mechanical breakdown but was fixed by technicians.

+ February 2025 audit report showed economical fuel consumption for motor vehicles for the month of February.

Generator fuel consumption rate was 32.01ltrs/hour.
